Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Eliyahoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for business purposes. The staff was kind and helping, the hotel was cozy and welcoming and the location was great, 300 m from Metro station 10 minutes walk from Gaudí's Park Güell.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about the staff...”
Reviews.Author: Heather220_1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a really nice modern building with decent rooms, good location (under 10 mins walk to La Sagrada Familia) and great breakfast. However the reception staff leave a LOT to be desired. The man checking us in was rather surly & rude. My mother took very ill on our 2nd night & needed a doctor. The receptionist really couldn't give a toss but booked us a taxi for hospital. My mother was clearly unwell and distressed & we had to work out which taxi was ours, get to A & E and get sorted. I really couldn't get over how uncaring and disinterested the receptionist was, I was disgusted by her attitude. On our last evening my mother had recovered & we asked another receptionist to recommend somewhere local to get paella. She couldn't do that, didn't have a clue about the local area. I'm sorry to write this as the hotel itself is great, I just can't believe that this chain doesn't train its staff on reception properly, it really lets the whole experience down.

Reviews.Title: “Good average”
Reviews.Author: Kari H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is good 3 star hotel but 4 star is too optimistic. Breakfast was overpriced. No possibility to buy tickets to Sagrada Familia even promised on hotel info and printed material on room. Near to Sagrada Familia and quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “very modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: jozef g Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i was really suprise when i arrive to the hotel it looks fresh and modern you have free internet . and if you are hungry you can eat at caffe , metro its in les then 10 minuts (alfonsoX) station from where to catalunya place its same maximum 15 minutes - if wlak down the road from hotel in about 10 minutes you are at Gaudi Sagrada familia - i would recomend the price was ok just i wish have breakfast in this price- we had a great holiday....thanks a lot....

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and location”
Reviews.Author: AndrisK89
Reviews.Content: The first impression wasn't the best. The room was not ready upon our arrival which was after check in time, luckly we could leave our bags in storage. After coming back to the room, it had a strong cigarette smell, but complaints to reception did not really change anything, as the toilet paper was covering fire detector, which did not seem appropriate for a 4* hotel. But for the price we paid it was quite reasonable experience and standart room was big enough. Have to admit that location is quite convenient, just 15 min from Familia Sagrada and 5 min from the nearest metro station which is a quick and cheap ride. Luis in reception was very helpful, thank you for that.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sfca00
Reviews.Content: Bed Bugs!!!! I was bitten all over my body. 8 bites on my right hand alone!!! Do not waste your money here!!! The staff is incredibly rude. We woke up to bed bugs in the middle of the night. Luis, the night receptionist, was not alarmed and not even apologetic. He didn't seem the least bit shocked. He moved us to a significantly smaller room. I asked for the manager and he said Ms. Sanchiz was on holiday, but she would contact us when she got back. We have yet to hear one word from management. We spoke with Annabel, morning receptionist, the following morning and she said, "To say sorry, we will do your laundry." The idiots put the laundry back on the bed!!! They offered no other compensation- not even to pay for our medication-over 100 Euros! My boyfriend had to go to the hospital for antibiotics! At the farmacia, the lady asked which hotel had the bed bugs. I said, "Confortel Bel Art" and she immediately said that she has heard about bed bugs there!!! Since Ms. Sanchiz has not contacted us, I can only assume that they have not fixed the bed bug problem and are continuing to rent the room to innocent travelers. Do not stay at Confortel Bel Art- they have very rude staff and bed bugs!!! Also, the most uncomfortable beds I've ever experienced (two twin beds pushed together to make a bigger bed-W.T.F!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel but a bit featureless”
Reviews.Author: TomJohnston
Reviews.Content: If you want to avoid the noise, filth and trashy people who tend to populate the centre of Barcelona on weekend nights (easyjet and ryanair hen and stag parties) then this is an ok location. Its a fairly modern hotel, rooms are a bit over designed and its extremely hard to get a double bed, but if you ok with twins you can push together but never feel like a double then its fine. Its really a business hotel but breakfast is fine, cold meats, cheese, bread, fruits, eggs, sausage and dry bacon. Location is fantastic for Segrada Familia which is only a few minutes walk away and metro is around 5 minutes. Dont expect old spanish charm, but its efficient and a decent enough place. I lived in Barcelona 6 years and avoided the centre like the plague at weekends, so when I return I stay here, but if you want to be right in the heart of the city, then this is NOT the hotel for you. Internet was fine when I was there, TV stations numerous but only English one is BBC World if that sort of thing is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off with lastminute.com”
Reviews.Author: morph48
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a three night stay at the Confortel Bel Art in Barcelona. We booked with lastminute.com, which was a big mistake! Rip off merchants! We paid €623 for a room basically! The fridge did not work, the hairdryer did no work and there were no English channels on the TV although the hotel manual said there were a few. The room was clean but very basic. It was definitely not 4 Star, more like 2 Star. The hotel had no functioning bar, so you couldn't even have a glass of wine or a cup of coffee in the evening. There is no atmosphere in the hotel at all! You would also be much better to book the hotel directly but unfortunately we were in the position that we had no choice as we were stuck in Barcelona with nowhere to stay (long story!) Lastminute.com had a price online which they then increased, saying that there were additional charges?? Never again is all I can say!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good atmosphere, great service. I'll stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Sjoensen
Reviews.Content: Staged 1 Night on a business trip. No problems at all. Nice and clean with good service and modern interior decoration. Quiet too. For vacation you are only a 10 minute walk from the cathedral Sagrada Familia but may find the old city centre a bit far.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel to stay whilst you explore the magical city!”
Reviews.Author: CurlyGurl-91
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very easy to find, as you come out of metro "alfonso X" just walk down the street until you come to it maybe 5minutes later on your left, Right next to the un finished cathedral in Sagrada Familia which is breathtaking, about a 40minute walk to the beach or 30minute walk to la ramblas, both walks are enjoyable though and there is plenty to see and do whiclst walking to these places, if not then both beach and la ramblas is minutes away on the metro, metro is very easy to use, i suggest you buy a t-10 ticket as that works out the cheapest and easiest. Check in and out were both very easy, staff very friendly, lobby and reception are very modern and clean, hotel room had a safe ensuite and tv, lovely views onto the street, clean modern bedrooms. Would definately stay in this hotel again as booked online with a good price. Places to eat "txapella" on passeig de gracia opposite bershka, amazing tapas, also " quinze Nitas" in plaza real, and "jambouree" in plaza real is a must if you love dancing. Mind your bags to pick pockets. Other than that i love Barcelona and would live there is i could.

Reviews.Title: “The worst night of the year”
Reviews.Author: Bricedupont
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the weekend with my girlfriend. The first night was terrible, as they just put 2 single beds next to each other and say it's a double room. And when you complain, they just explain that the real double bedroom are subject to availability. But we booked a double room. After complaining, we had a double room for our second night. Then the problem was the Curtains. They are so thin, that the light wakes you up from 7am and the sun is strong in Barcelone. At the end of the weekend, I was more tired than after a week of work. So just book this hotel is you want to have a terrible stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to this hotel, big dissapointment!!!”
Reviews.Author: marcoadriano
Reviews.Content: CLeanliness: there was a very bad smell in our room (like sewer), there were hairs in the bathtub, and a lot of things (like the sink) were broken Location: On their website they say the hotel is very near to the centre and clubscene, this nis not true! Thank god a taxi is cheap in Barcelona! Only thing nearby is the Sagrada Familia Services: The wireless internetconnection is very bad, even the staff admitted this (because they have to work with the same connection). It takes hours to load a page....Furthermore they don't have an iron available for your clothing. If you ask them to iron it for you, it will cost you 15 euro's, but they cannot do it on the same day.... (they also have ridiculous rules and prices for washing your clothes) Staff: They were ok, only the breakfast staff is a bit weird, they already clean up before breakfast time is over....and also never ask the hotel to arrange a taxi for you, you pay twice as much! Noise: This is very bad, the walls are very very very thin.... Rooms: The rooms are outdated, small, messy, smelly etc. The bed was horrible, the matras was old and hard. Also only 2 pillows available.... Value: Totally not worth it, we booked last minute so we even paid more. They call themselves a 4 star hotel, but this is really 1 or 2 stars.... When you go to your room you will see the BIG difference with the entrance...and that's a BIG dissapointment!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms let it down a bit”
Reviews.Author: vicki1978
Reviews.Content: Fairly cheap hotel, which are generally difficult to find in Barcelona - and much better than the various hostels on offer. Location is not that great - it is quite a long way out of the centre and up a big hill! However the neighbourhood feels safe and does have some good attractions close by - the Sagrada Familia and the old hospital. There are some places to eat and drink close by but you are better off catching the metro back into the centre (metro station fairly close to the hotel). The communal parts of the hotel are excellent - very swanky with huge stunning light fittings - the restaurant is good and provided a great buffet breakfast (not cooked) - however the rooms let the hotel down slightly as they are a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Priyank82
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona in August and stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Location was good. Just 10 mins walk to Sagrada Familiya. Rooms were clean, bathroom was also clean. Breakfast was also very good. Only problem was wireless internet was not working and one out of three PC in the lounge for internet was not working. For other PCs internet speed was very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Poor and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: millyweeble
Reviews.Content: This hotel claims to be a four star...ABSOLUTELY NO WAY! The reception area was tacky, not arty...no wonder some photographers get paid large sums of money...they made a silk purse out of a sows ear for the hotel's web site! Service was non-existent, never anyone on reception. The rooms were bare and basic. The bed was small and uncomfortable, the pillow appeared thicker than the mattress. No tea-making facilities, no toiletries, bathroom decor was horrid (70's style), towels and bed linen were worn. Only semi-good thing about this hotel was a wonderful little cafe at the end of the street called 'Opera'...really great tapas to be had there!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sensor30
Reviews.Content: Staff hardly speaking English (in Barcelona only tourists speak English, locals speak only Catalan and a bit of Spanish!). The hotel is rated 4*, but I have stayed at better 2* hotels in Paris (Ibis Gare de Lyon, for example). Even we have booked the room as husband and wife, we were offered a separated beds room. The beds had wheels with no locking mechanism. As a consequence, you could drive your bed while sleeping! The beds were moving on the laminated floor, separating all the time from each other. One night we were woke up by a very loud noise above: I think somebody took the chance on really sleeping in such bads and fell on the floor. The room was very small. In the marble bathroom we could find molds on corners and pubic hair from previous guests in the bathtube and the bidet. No shoes polishing sponges (we were given after specifically asking for at the reception). We had to call the management and they replaced the beds with no-wheels beds, but still moving on the slippery laminated floor. They put silicone on the corners growing molds, picked up the pubic hair and even provided us with tooth brushes. Unfortunately, when we come back in the room in the evening we discover the window was not closing. Solving the problem: incredible, the night manager came with a heavy copier paper box and leaned it against the window to help keeping it closed. She said it is all she can do until morning and blamed us for asking too much for a hotel in Barcelona. Anyway we were given a double bed room next day and the stay was acceptable. The breakfast is not so various for a 4* hotel and expensive for what is offering. Very bad coffee. The internet in the lobby is good, but the keyboards are adapted to Spanish and uncomfortable for users of standard English boards. If you make the mistake to stay at this hotel, at least do not make the mistake of asking the reception to call you a cab. They work with the drivers who will drive you around the city for some extra 5 euros and the receptionist gets payed a commission from the taxi company (I overheard them on the walkie-talkie). The location is good. If you leave the hotel, take the metro from downhill (Sagrada Familia); when you come to the hotel get off the up hill station Alfons X. Excellent sushi restaurants in the area. They also serve a variety of Sangria in which they add some sake and the result is extraordinary, the best Sangria you can drink in Barcelona. If you like Toledo swords, you can find a lot on Rambla, at prices 100-200 Euros. Watch out for fake. Best Toledo swords for this money are from manufacturer Marto and bear the mark on the blade. If you pay cash, you will get a 20-30% discount, depending on your negotiating skills. Gorgeous old Gothic Cathedral with the place for the gathering of the noblemen and the garden. Must see the magic fountain in Placa d'Espagna A special reccomendation for the flamenco show at the Opera y Flamenco at Panoramio Theatre. Outstanding dancer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: hifh_rock
Reviews.Content: There is nothing particularly wrong with this hotel. It is in a good location for both the Sagrada Familia and Parc Guell, is clean and is good value for Barcelona. Rooms are of a decent size and bathrooms are large and fully functional, and in the area around the hotel there are many restaurants and bars serving tapas and more substantial meals for a lot less than what you would be likely to pay around Las Ramblas. On the other hand however, the majority of rooms appear to be designated as smoking, which obviously results in non-smokers experiencing a rather unpleasant smell. Additionally, a curtain in our room came complete with a hole which looked as though a previous occupier had either inadvertently left it draped over the nearby lamp or burnt it with a cigarette - regardless of which, it badly needed to be replaced. Finally, although the location is fine, to visit Las Ramblas and the waterfront there really is no option other than to make use of public transport unless you wish to spent several hours each day on your feet: the metro is excellent but changing lines can result in a trek of more than half a mile through underground corridors. Overall, a good value hotel in a reasonable location but one that does not really live up to its four-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is all show...but not reflected in rooms.”
Reviews.Author: LeapFrog26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights over the Easter weekend. Rooms are basic but clean. Walls are paper thin, so if you do stay here make sure you have earplugs!!! Bathroom was dated and there was mold growing in the corners of the shower/bath. April is considered "Winter" so aircon only blew hot air....luckily we could open the window. This hotel would be ok value for approx €55 per night. Unfortunately we booked this as part of the LastMinute.com - Top Secret Hotels and paid approx €90 per night. We have stayed in much nicer hostels!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Bobbik0523
Reviews.Content: Hotel reception looks very nice, check-in without any problem. You can find in the lobby free internet corner. Rooms are adequate. I have seen better 3* rooms, but it is ok. If you don´t expect luxurious 4* property, you will be satisfied. Bathroom is so so, but clean and equipped. Free bottles of water in the fridge :) You can hear the rush in the corridor, but it is not so horrible as described in previous reviews. And only 2 english channels? Oh my god, who cares? You are in Barcelona!! Hotel is located just outside of the city centre, but with a great tranportation possibilities. Closest station is AlfonsX, about 3 minutes walk, which connects you directly with the gothic quarter (about 10 minutes) or Urqinaona stop (only 100m to Placa Catalunya). Hotel can be reached by a train and L4 combination from the airport. It takes about 1hour and half, but it costs only 0,77EUR if you buy the 10 tickets carnet for 7.70. Metro is running in few minutes intervals until midnigt, on weekends until 2am. For 0,77 EUR ticket valid for about 80 minutes, this is a great service! As mentioned, Sagrada Familia is 10 miuntes walk from the hotel with another metro line situated there. Near the metro Alfons X, you can find a Consum market there, where you can buy your breakfast. Closest fast foods (as kebab food or KFC, Mc Donalds) could be find near the Sagrada Familia. Summarized: if you do not mind travelling in public transport, this is a great option for your stay. Fof the price about 60 EUR, do not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “good valoue-location just ok”
Reviews.Author: donaldgregoryBelfast
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at Bel Art. Very near Alfonso x Metro and just down the street bus 47 takes you into the Ramblas. Good choice if the price is right . Staff friendly and free internet in lobby. Quiet area but lots of bars restaurants close especially the Italian 5 minutes down the hill-on a corner callede Piazz -----? If you want to save good bit of money worth a stay. Free safe in room with free water in minibar. Supermarket very close and cheap local bars

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too noisy laminate floor not carpet”
Reviews.Author: Elena_Gilbert
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days. The hotel and room was kept clean, was spacious and has a modernistic feel about it. It was cleaned daily and had free water in the mini bar. There are three internet computers on the groiund floor which are free for hotel guests. The hotel rooms do not have carpet which might have helped to dampen noise and so the main problem we faced was the noise generated by other hotel guests in the early hours of the night i.e people next door and upstairs walking about in high heel shoes on floor boarding. Had there been carpet I'm sure this noise would not have been generated. We stayed room only so cannot comment on the food. There is no bar and so we had to go to a smokey bar next door for a drink. The location of the hotel is away from the main attractions and bars/restaurants but the Metro is 8 mins walk and 20 mins ride to the La Ramla. We picked this hotel based on its 4 star rating and price so I guess we would have to pay more for a four star closer to the centre. Tip: "We made the mistake of doing the city tour a couple of days too late. Do this first day at 21 Euros each per day. The bus takes you around the whole city north and south and you are provided with headphones which provides you with a commentry on all of the key attractions. It takes 4 hours in all but next time we will select different stops and places to see and keep getting on and off the bus after each attraction. There are buses every 5 mins. We noted that many people were doing this and had bought a two day ticket."

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but only B&B”
Reviews.Author: scifilucy
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed at the Confortel Bel Art for 3 nights in August. The lobby is very modern and stylish. The rooms are not quite so nice, much more basic but was very clean and had a nice en-suite with bath. You get a fridge and safe included. Although the details say 'free minibar', as we got a last minute cheap deal the only liquid to be found in the fridge was water, but it was still appreciated! So was the air con! it was so amazingly hot we spent most of the day lounging with it on full blast! but it worked brilliantly. The bed was comfy and also very clean, no faults here. Free internet is only in the lobby, and you can use one of 3 computers for free but you have to pay for wi-fi in the rooms. The telly was a bit of a let down, the only exclusively english channels you could get without paying extra were CNN and BBC world news, MTV was free, but was sometimes dubbed into Dutch, and Eurosport was watchable but only if you speak fluent german! The lady on reception was friendly and helpfull, the only fault I can really make is the lovely stylish resturant is only for breakfast, you cannot have lunch or an evening meal here. As it was a last minute deal, i booked room only, thinking we could add on food if we wanted to, but you can't, so dont stay here if you want a meal without going out for it. The breakfast was a bit of a rip off, 14 euros each! and to our surprise amongst the usual continental offerings of bread based products, juices and various slices of sausage/meat, we found sweets, like fizzy cola bottles etc, which we thought was most odd, but ate nonetheless. We only gave in to paying the said 14 euros after a fruitless couple of hours scouring the already roasting Barcelona streets in search of some sophisticated breakfast which we couldnt find because most of the cafe's dont open til 10. However, as it was quite late when we went to breakfast , and there was not much food left, we only had to pay for one which was a relief on a budget. The next day I found a little supermarket just down the road where i bought provisions for snacks, which was much cheaper. The nearest metro station was 5 mins walk up the road, and i must say it is a great way to get around. its cheap and very clean and easy to navigate. The hotel is a little bit out of the city centre, and so on our return we would chose a different hotel, but really because of the location, and the fact that it doesn't have a pool. As it is more of a B&B i wouldn't recommend this hotel to families who want an easy break, as hunting for food can be a bit tiresome. However, its very good for couples/singles who just want a base to explore this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but lacking some services”
Reviews.Author: badcop
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here at end of June. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is not bad, close to metro station which gave easy access to city centre. As others have stated, there is currently a building site next door, but I was not disturbed by it. Hotel was clean and room comfortable,with limited TV channels,but there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room, which made the fact that there was no room service incomprehensible. I popped to the cafe next door for coffee. Breakfast at the hotel was adequate. I found it odd that the hotel had no terrace on which to enjoy the balmy weather. Good value as I had a 2 nights for the price of 1 offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mrscoml
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed in this hotel for four nights. Room was excellent in terms of size and amenities. Both the room and bathroom extremely clean, as was rest of the hotel. The mini bar is really just a fridge but the hotel provides free bottles of water which are repenished daily. Although room was on front of hotel it was quiet as glazing kept out traffic noise. Stayed there with friend to celebrate her birthday and once staff knew this they sent her a bottle of Cava. All the staff in the hotel were very friendly and efficient, any we spoke to were charming and helpful. Breakfast was very good, standard continental choices. Top tip for getting there...from Alphons X it is a short walk to the hotel downhill, slightly longer walk from Sagrada Familia, up gentle hill all the way. Do not miss the Sant Pau Hospital which is about 10 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gabina030
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for three nights to celebrate my 30th birthday. Having booked the 'Romantic room' through LastMinute.com for about £100 extra, we expected something a little bit special. Unfortunately we were both very disappointed. Apart from the promised bottle of Cava and few chocolates, the room had nothing romantic about it. I probably haven't stayed in less romantic one! The standard of the room was by no means four star! The room had an outdated decor, the bed was extremely uncomfortable (would probably compare it to the cheapest Ikea guest bed), the bathroom was in poor state of disrepair. We had to be moved to different room after the showerhead broke on our second day. The reception and lobby areas are immaculate and impressive but don't get fooled by these like we did. The rooms are a different story! Don't stay in this hotel if you expect four star standard of accomodation and friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: rcallagh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, on a cheap city break. The location is not completely central but if you don't mind doing a little walking or taking the metro then its ideal for a short break away. Only a 6/7 min walk to the nearest Metro station, and about 10 min walk to Sagrada Familia which also has some lovely Tapas restaurants along a pedestrian walkway. The hotel itself is clean and perfectly functional if you don't plan on doing much lounging around. The rooms are small but modern and have all the necessary facilities. The lobby is large, bright and welcoming with free internet access. We arrived very late (nearly midnight) and were checked in straight away by a very courteous male clerk who had everything ready for us. Unfortunately we never woke up in time for breakfast so can't comment on this! Overall I would recommend this hotel as a good base if you want to do plenty of sightseeing or partying! Plenty of taxis passing by at night for heading out!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay here”
Reviews.Author: Funkmasterflex
Reviews.Content: I went and the place was having major renovations to most of the hotel. Went to check in there were 3 staff behind the counter, none of them wanted to check us in. When someone managed to find the effort to serve us they were incredibly rude. The hotel is at the wrong end of the city, all the attractions are near the bay area. It is only a 20 min walk from la Sagrada familia

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some people say...”
Reviews.Author: tannedchick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Easter for 3 nights and booked through LMinute.com. The hotel reception is clean and modern with free internet and WIFI. I didn´t sample the breakfast so can´t comment but there are plenty of cafes in the area which serve good coffee and croissants at a fraction of the price in the hotel. The rooms were clean, no evidence of a wonky bed and the bathroom was clean with a nice shower. The only thing i did experience was during the day, when most people are out anyway, there was alot of noise (doors slamming and people talking) which seemed like my door was wide open it was that loud. Not great when trying to have a siesta! The hotel is on a hill as other people have mentioned. Uphill to the Metro stop which was no great deal for me as i am young and fit but could be a pain for the less able. I found the Metro stop really handy as i could go into the centre and to the beach on the same line and if you stay on until El Maresme Forum you will get to El Diagonal de Mar, a huge shopping centre which came in really handy when the weather turned grey. Overall i liked the hotel, yes the staff were sometimes difficult (well a couple of them) but others were really helpful in pointing out places for me to go. I liked the fact it was slightly outside the centre as it was my first time in the city and it got me away from the hecticness when i wanted it. I suppose it depends on what the individual prefers. I would consider coming back here unless there was a better offer elsewhere and i will definitely be coming back to Barcelona, i loved it!

Reviews.Title: “poor hotel-dissapointing service-won´t be coming here again!”
Reviews.Author: fifteenadvisor
Reviews.Content: Where to start? 20 minute up hill walk to the hotel from hospital de sant pau (not 3 minutes as mentioned). The welcome was not great-we had to find our own room and were not told about how the lights work. The room was a standard room however the decor was not brilliant and not at all like the lobby/reception area(do not be fooled by photos). The bed was horrible-we could not sleep for the first 2 nights-just a thin matress which was very squeeky and noisy (when we complaint about this-there was no response given). The air conditioning which they said they had, did not exist- only heating system, which i feel is ridiculous in a generally hot country. (so had to leave the window open-very noisy) The bath tub was in a very bad condition-with rust and dents and towels were very rough against skin. Mini bar was free, however only water was provided (and the water didn´t taste quite right) oh and there was a chipped glass in the mini bar too. The tv had a terrible signal and a lamp was not working. The only good thing was that the hotel was close by to the sagrada famillia. I personally did not like this place at all- there arent that many photos of the rooms available cause their not worth showing. I wouldn´t recommend this place to anyone. Definatly not a 4 * hotel-more like 2*.

Reviews.Title: “Good value out of centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silverthou
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, the 4 star rating is probably a bit ambitious, nevertheless the rooms were reasobaly spacious, clean and had a good aircon system. Breakfast buffet was plentiful, although if you like 'cooked' the scrambled eggs and greasy bits of bacon and sausage did not look that appetising. Otherwise plenty of meats, cheeses, fruit cereals and bread. The hotel is about 1/2 mile uphill from Segrada Familia, and the location being 'out of town' meant we saw a lot more than we would have if based in the centre. Alfons X tube station is 200 yds away, a 10 journey ticket, which can be used on tube, bus, tram or train is good value at 7.7 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Worst 4 Star ever”
Reviews.Author: CityBreakersUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 28 Feb to 3 Mar 09. We paid £270 for 3 nights for a so called superior suit on Last minute.com. According to the hotel, the choice of accommodation is either a ‘junior’ suite and a ‘standard’ suite. No superior suite is available. The room we were allocated was a junior suite, but It was the worst 4 star hotel we ever stayed. On arrival, there was no greeting from the receptionist. We had to introduce ourselves and tell him we had a room booked. We were told we had a very good room but it was actually very poor. We were told there was no better room to swap with, unless we were prepared to downgrade. No refund for the price difference was offered. The room was hot, dry and dimly lit. We could hear the adjoining occupants through the thin walls. The bed was two singles put together to make a queen, (according to the receptionist, the hotel didn’t do queen beds in any of their rooms). The mattress were old, noisy, and uncomfortable. The pillows were inadequate. The bathroom was old and scruffy. The plughole in the dirty bath was blocked, with water up to our ankles when using the shower. We asked for it to be unblocked three times. Despite being assured the problem would be fixed, it never was. We’ve done many city breaks, know what to expect from 4 star accommodation, and are not given to complaining. But this is a below-par hotel, where the guests are treated as an inconvenience. We’d recommend staying else ware if you don’t want your visit to this beautiful city spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, average location”
Reviews.Author: Linda77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully decorated and the room was very comfortable, although the usual European small size, but there was a bath with a shower over it. When I arrived around 9pm there was only sandwiches being served in the restaurant - hot food was pizza ordered in or going out to a tapas bar. The location worked for me as I've been to Barcelona before so didn't need to stay centrally. The hotel is 5 minutes walk down the hill from the metro station Alfons X, and you can also walk down the hill to the Sagrada Familia, which would take about 10-15minutes. The neghbourhood is residential you have to walk 5 minutes to find a local shop, but very quiet and safe. The minibar in the room was well stocked with free bottles of mineral water, which was handy.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ThornClaire
Reviews.Content: A well made out Hotel with a stylish lobby and good clean rooms very close to the Sagrada Familia. The hotel staff are both friendly and helpful and are always ready to give excellent advice. Plenty of reasonable eateries within strolling distance. All in all we only stayed days but the Hotel and Staff made it a very pleasurable experience for the both of us :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Lankyswan
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 night s from 4th Feb 2009, well located for a number of metro stops and buses, it is out of the centre but if you are able bodied you will not have a problem. All staff were very friendly and helpful, we were directed to a really good local restaurant which we used a couple of times. Comfortable and clean will use again.

Reviews.Title: “4 star? I don't think so. Trip advisor reviews very fair.”
Reviews.Author: osopeludo
Reviews.Content: I booked on LastMinute.com. One of those deals where you dont know the actual hotel until after you've booked. Fify one euros for a decent Barcelona isnt bad. Reception. Some reviews criticize the staff. "Marc" was the only member on duty. He was friendly but, how can I put it, unhelpful. I asked about wifi in the rooms and the mini bar. Were they both free, as mentioned in Trip Advisor? Yes, Marc told me, both are free. I went to the room, with my wife, on the third floor. The credit card type key didnt work. Back to Reception. Marc reset it. No apology. Back to the third floor. Key worked. I set up my laptop. Password needed. If the guy in reception KNEW that I wanted wifi isnt it reasonable to volunteer a password at the time of checking in? Back to Reception. Marc printed out a password. No apology. Wifi worked. I looked in the "free" mini bar. SIX small bottles of still water arranged like chess pieces on a board. Later I mentioned this lack of choice to Marc. I was told that the bottles were FREE and Spain is in the midst of a financial crisis. As in other reviews the bathroom definitely had an unpleasant pong to it. The bathroom had a full bath and plenty of hot water. The two water glasses were NOT in plastic bags. The toiletries were definitely on the skinny side. 1 small soap, 1 gel and 1 shampoo. The bedroom. Twin beds pushed together with just a thin blanket and sheets on each. The furniture was functional but the lighting was inadequate. With the desk light and both bedside lights on it was still too gloomy to read a map! The room was quiet, rather hot and had a slightly boring view onto the street in front. On checking out in the morning, there was a queue at Reception. Only one member of staff on although there was a girl sitting behind a strange desk faced by coloured balls only a few metres ago who could easily have helped. She never stirred. A common thread in reviews in Tip Advisor is the star rating of various hotels, including Bel Art here. This simply isnt up to a FOUR star rating. It is an OK THREE star. Nothing more. The price of 51 euros didnt include breakfast and we didnt stay for any food. Please also read my review of Hotel Bonanova Park, Barcelona. I stayed there the following night. Although the Bonanova is only a TWO star it compares well with the Bel Art.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: nikki1605
Reviews.Content: Not long arrived back from a holiday in Barcelona where my boyfriend and I stayed at the Confortel Bel Art, Hotel was great, good value for money (we were room only). Staff were very friendly and room was clean and quiet, slight whiff of drains in the bathroom at times but you only have to walk around the city to know this is not an isolated occurence! There was some building work going on during our stay and it looks like it's turning ultra modern which looked great and we certainly didn't hear any of the work going on. Hotel is on a hill so great for the legs! A few hundred yards up the hill is Alfons X metro (yellow line) and cost 1.30 euro for a single ticket, you could purchase 10 journeys which worked out cheaper but we generally walked everywhere. Some lovely cafe's and resturants very close to the hotel and a supermarket down the hill, take the first right - so all very convenient. We did find as it was more in a residential than tourist area not everyone spoke English (except at Hotel) but we got by with a little pointing and some gestures! Our room was made up every day and the mini-bar was free and re- stocked daily with water, juice and beer. Room also contained a safe, extra pillows etc. and black out curtains so all in all very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Belart value&location”
Reviews.Author: jeancan
Reviews.Content: Booked on 1800hotels.ie. Very pleased.Lovely quiet location, strolling distance of Ave.Gaudi with al fresco cafes with SagradaFamilia at end of Av.Gaudi.On yellow line metro alfons X but bus 92 going to the Port (and 14) outside the door and other buses within a stone's throw of the door.We used bus 92 to get us to the shuttlebus for cruise port (at Mirador Colon) - easy peasey. Staff lovely, friendly, helpful and know the city. Bedroom functional, adequate, clean, fab air-con (quiet) but the skimpiest curtains I've ever seen.I also got a wonky bed, one of a twinbeds.My husband's bed was grand. Good maintenance.Breakfast excellent.I've no hesitation is saying its a great value for money hotel in a tranquil area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at the Confortel.....”
Reviews.Author: gav353530
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Confortel Bel Art on the 13&14 May 2008 before boarding a four day cruise on the med. We also stayed on the 19 May 2008 prior to our return flight to belfast. First things first the hotel is near the Sagria Familia so is not in the centre of Barcelona or the Ramblas. But it is only 200m from the Alfons X metro station and a simple five stop journey takes you to the centre. The hotel is exceptionaly clean, breakfast is beautiful and best of all the mini bar is free. We checked in on the 19th at 9.30am and the hotel was more than happy to accomodate us with a room. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sewer smell and misleading list of free amenities”
Reviews.Author: alliesun98
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't all bad, but there were several things that made our stay less than perfect. -My parents' room smelled horribly of sewage, and when the front desk was notified, their solution was to have housekeeping come and spray it with air freshener. I would have insisted on changing rooms, but my parents didn't want the hassle of repacking all their stuff. Our room, which was 2 doors down, smelled perfectly fresh. -The brochure in the room listed several free amenities including a free minibar, free WIFI in the room and several different types of pillows (foam, feather and something else I can't remember). My parents asked for feather pillows for our second night's stay and the people at the front desk looked at them like they were crazy...said they didn't have feather pillows. Umm..okay, then don't advertise that you do! -The rooms were pretty clean, but there were some stray hairs in the tub and sink (not our hair) and the phone looked like it had never been wiped down. -Breakfast was delicious but not included and, in my opinion, really overpriced - 17 euro per person (at the current exchange rate that is about $25 a person!) -Location didn't bother me, as it was within about a 3 block walk to the nearest metro station (Alfons X). I actually liked being in the residential area because it meant less street noise at night. Overall, I'd give it a 3 out of 5 - I mean, it was a nice place, but for what we paid per night I just expected a little more in the way of service and I really think that breakfast should have been included.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: madridfan
Reviews.Content: The Confortel Bel Art is a very comfortable hotel, but it was not as centrally located as I would have liked it to be. I knew going in that it was not in the middle of the city center, but I did not realize that it was in such a residential area. However, the Alons X metro stop on line four was located close to the hotel. It was nice that the mini bar in the hotel was free, but it only included drinks.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aburel
Reviews.Content: Trying to see Barcelona at reasonable prices we found this hotel. It is located in a very nice and quiet area, not far from Sagrada Familia at 5 minutes walking from a subway station. Very nice staff, good and assorted breakfast. Rooms are clean and nice. Bar is closed too quickly and dinner is available until 10pm but arround the corner is Cafe del Teatro, a nice bistro with nice food, charming staff, very friendly and helpful, even if they don't speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - just a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: travelshep
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel - modern, clean, every amenitie you could think of and the staff is tremendous and proactive. BUT you will pay for the experience. Don't even think of opening the mini-bar. All in all though, very much worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, good location”
Reviews.Author: SteveBEngland
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived at the Hotel I was a little worried about my choice but everything was good. Quiet location with a few bars/cafes nearby. Just down the road from Alfons X metro station from which you can get to the Barri Gothic (Jaume 1) in 10 minutes without changing lines. 15 minutes walk to Sagrada Famillia and a further 45 minutes to Place Catalunya. Hotel was quiet with occasional noise from neighbours arriving and leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bel Art”
Reviews.Author: DOMENECH
Reviews.Content: My and my husband are planning to come back to Barcelona. We don,t dubt to stay again in the Bel Art Hotel. You can,t bit it. There is a georgeous restaurant where you can try Mediterranean Cuisine. All staff speaks english and there is a japanese recepcionist. The Hotels is located ina a residential area close to the Sagrada Familia. You have 3 metro stations near by to visit the Center.

Reviews.Title: “Not an ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: PaulineBankfoot
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day break at the Bel Art Hotel, and thought an update would be good for this Web Site. The Hotel is OK, would agree that it is not a real 4 Star, as we saw other 4 Star Hotels in Barcelona that were far better equipped than the Bel Art. The previous write ups regarding being next door to a nightclub worried me (the booking was a surprise weekend away with my family). Good news it is now closed and being bulldozed!! I would not liked to have stayed there when it was open, as it would have been a nightmare. The food at the hotel is fine (again, nowhere near 4 Star), the staff OK (nowhere near 4 Star) and the bedrooms OK (yes, you've guessed the next word). The location is the hotels biggest downside. I read in the website that the hotel is 300m's from the Sagrada Famillila....Rubbish. it must be about 1.2 miles away on foot through some quiet residential locations that were not comfortable walking through. We tried the Metro the first night, got the diections from the hotel, and went by every word, and got off the Metro even further away from where we wanted to get to!! With a wife, and 2 children, I was not that impressed. You would have thought a "4 Star" hotel, or any hotel that would have guests looking to get to the nearest tourist location, would have done their homework and got their directions correct!! To sum up, we taxi'd in and out of the city centre (approx 8-12 euros depending on taxi driver!) at all times. If however, you wanted to go to Barcelona, be in amongst the hype, noise and fun, but be able to taxi back to a quiter location then this could be the place for you, but I would suggest you look to other locations first. In summary, reasonable hotel, terrible location.....look elsewhere and give this hotel a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location”
Reviews.Author: Hime_lise
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked great in the pictures and the reception was nice, but the rooms were small-ish and not what I would consider 4 star (except for the breakfast which was exceptional). Although it was a decent walking distance to the Sagrada Familia (about 20min) it was a good 20min taxi ride to the harbour or Las Ramblas. One wall of hotel is shared with a local (non-touristy) night club which wasn't noisy but a good night out for anyone into clubbing!

Reviews.Title: “Would not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: SM123
Reviews.Content: The hotel does not warrant a 4 star rating, does not have the facilities or services to warrant it. Hotel rooms were small & pokey however they were clean. Stayed 5 nights in Oct 06, restaurant was never open, bar had limited services, found hotel staff to be unfriendly. Location a bit far out from centre, however metro line close by, enjoyed Barcelona, would return there, but would not stay in the BelArt Hotel and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Rather mediocre - definitely not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: neilmadhvani
Reviews.Content: The Bel Art doesn't feel like a 4* hotel at all, especially due to the lack of facilities one might expect from a hotel with this rating. There's no business centre on site, no fitness facilities or pool, and in the rooms there were only a handful of terrestrial channels with very poor reception, all of which were in Spanish. The room was clean, but very small. Especially as there were 3 of us, the extra bed took up so much space that it was very difficult getting from one part of the room to the other! Service at reception was generally very friendly and the staff were helpful, though it felt they were under pressure due to there being not many of them. This was particularly noticeable at breakfast, where there was only waitress trying to clear the tables, replenish breakfast items and various other things. On a positive note, the breakfast was pretty good, and we were happy with the cleanliness of the room, particularly the bathroom. Also, the hotel offered free WiFi access and this worked fine from the lobby. All in all, not a bad stay, but perhaps a little overpriced. I've stayed in better 3* hotels in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Bel Smell”
Reviews.Author: ExpertVerdict
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bel Art in August 2006 for 4 nights having booked 2 rooms for our family of 4. On arrival we were given rooms on the second floor. They stlll had ashtrays in them despite our request for non smoking and smelt strongly of deoderiser - we complained and were moved to ground floor rooms which were basic but clean, but still smelt of deoderiser. I suspect they allow guests to smoke in all the rooms. The staff were pleasant enough but the cleaning staff are determined to use strong cleaning products. One evening we heard them scrubbing the hall carpets outside our rooms with amonia - we had to go out to escape the fumes. They also like things strong in the hotel bar. We requested 2 white coffees which we couldn't drink - they were so strong! I feel this hotel would equate to a 2 or 3 star rating in the UK. All the rooms at the back face a buildings about 10 feet away which are also on a small alleyway down which motorcycles speed long into the night. We have stayed in Barcelona before without any problems so were really diappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: keel
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and we use this hotel quite a bit, so i decided to go and see what it was like for myself and I wasnt disapointed. The hotel itself is excellent. The rooms are a good size as are the bathrooms. The only problem we had was that you dont have tea and coffee facilities in your room and the bar in reception is only open from 6pm to 11pm. The breakfasts in the morning as lovely, they offer anything from fruit and cereal to cook breakfast all in buffett style. the breakfast is availble from around 8am to 11am. The hotel itself is a bit far out from the main area of barcelona, but there are several restaurants within a ten minute walk to the diagonal area. The "alfons" metro is a 5min walk to the top of the street and about 3/4 stops later you are in the "Gracia" area which is excellent for shopping. The Las Ramblas area is again about 5mins walk from the Gracia area and is well worth a visit, although watch your wallets and handbags when you are watching the street entertainers. The port olympic is the area I loved the most, a taxi from the hotel to here is about 6euros and the reception staff are more than helpful is ordering and aggreeing a price, although our taxi driver on the first night decided to radio ahead and booked us a table in a very expensive restaurant so be careful of that. He didnt speak mushc english so we werent aware until he pulled up at the hotel as to what he was at. The meal was ovely but very costly. taxis are availble anywhere and everywhere, but you are not allowed to flag them down. The have to be stationary at traffic lights b4 they will allow you to get into them. They are not allowed to stop in taxi/bus lanes or they receive penalty points, but taxi ranks are everywhere. All in all I loved Barcelona and I would stay in the hotel again no problem. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: freiberufler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bel Art in late June 2006 when I went to B. with a girlfriend for a long weekend. Overall this is a very good choice for the price (we paid around 40 euro each per night for a double room via [--], for three nights - expedia's price was 100 euros more in total). We did not have breakfast. We were not exactly greeted with enthusiasm when we arrived late afternoon; that may be due to a very large group of youngsters arriving at the same time. In any case we were given our room card and assigned a first-floor room looking out onto the street. The bar two doors down unfortunately operates a long-hours policy at weekends and a group of young people sat out on the street until 4 am which was extremely loud. As my fellow traveller insisted on keeping the window open this was a real nuisance, having said that the central a/c worked perfectly and we could have closed the window. Next morning we requested a room looking out the other way and that was no problem at all, despite the hotel being fairly full. This room was very quiet. The hotel is very clean and pleasant to look at, and the rooms were absolutely adequate with a modern and recently refurbished feel to them. The location is also brilliant - rather than the crowded and loud Barri Gotic this is about 15 minutes away from the centre by bus or metro (nearest metro is Alfonso XX, about 200 yards up the hill, and the bus down to town or to the beachfront leaves from directly outside). Sagrada Familia is about 10 mins walk away and there are plenty of small bars to have breakfast in. No complaints, apart from a minor gripe: the staff's English is not great, and they do tend to sound rather abrupt, not to mention rude, because of this. However, they were helpful about our room change and also phoned two restaurants for us to make bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: CatiePie
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from Barcelona where we stayed at the Bel Art Hotel. Like a previous reviewer we came here by way of one of their other hotels that had problems with the lift. Whilst it is out of town, just up from the Sagredia Familia, the public transport is extremely good. Catch the number 10 bus from just across the road and this will take you straight down to the sea front. Catch the 92 bus it will also take you down to the sea but on a much longer journey. All the bus stops have a name and a map of all the stops on the route. A short walk away is the Alfons (yellow Line) metro stop. My advice is don't take a taxi into the city unless you have to. It cost us 15 euros one night when its only 1.40 euros on public transport. Definately recommend the T10 ticket which gives you 10 journeys for 6.35 euros. As long as your journey takes no more than 1.15 hours you can change onto different metro lines; tram; bus and train and it will still be classed as one journey. Fantastic. We felt extremely safe in this area. Recommend the bar next door to the hotel. There is a tapas bar a bit further down called Bar Teatre. (closed Sunday and Monday evenings) Lovely food - got a sandwich for lunch one day with a tortilla filling. Sounds strange but it's very good. Taxi from the airport cost 31 euros a bit steep but it was our first time in Barcelona and when we return we will be using the T10 tickets to get across on the airport bus and then the metro. Though difficult negotiating steps with all your baggage. Not every station has an escalator. The taxi drivers always have the meter running when they are pre-booked be warned. The hotel does a menu of the day at a very good price of 12 euros for three courses including bread and a glass of wine. Food was lovely. Plenty of choice. NB: Restaurant is closed on Saturday and Sunday evenings. Also breakfasts were excellent - a mixture of sweet and savoury which would suit all tastes Watch out for pick pockets but don't let it put you off. Be particularly careful on busy trains/metro I would be happy to recommend this hotel. The staff all speak English and they are very helpful and friendly. Hope you enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights at the Bel Art after being transferred on arrival from the hotel we were booked into because 'the lift is broken'. We were advised before arrival to get a taxi from the airport but if you know the location of your hotel get the airport bus which is very cheap, very frequent and goes right into the centre of Barcelona to the square at Catalunya - you can get a bus or Metro from there if necessary. The Bel Art hotel is situated in a quiet, clean district where I felt very safe, and is just a few minutes from Alfons X metro station on the yellow line. The hotel was extremely clean, despite the fact that redecoration was in progress during our stay. No view from the window, but we didn't go to Barcelona to sit on a hotel balcony. Our room was thoroughly cleaned every day, including clean sheets on the comfortable bed and clean towels in the bathroom. Downside was the room safe did not work, more coat hangers would have been useful and TV was not satellite but Spanish channels, a couple of German channels plus CNN and BBC World with very bad reception. Single film on offer was pay per view as were more adult offerings. The breakfast was a veritable feast with something for every one with savoury and sweet, hot and cold, frequently and discreetly replenished by staff. All staff were very helpful and interacted very well in English. Reception staff always willing to help with everything from directions to the loan of a mobile phone recharger. Overall impression was clean and comfortable and I would recommend to anyone not bothered about being a little out of town. Best full meal was at Port Vell restaurant on Passeig di Joan do Borbo and best light meal was Grupo Babilonia next to Temple do la Sagrada Familia.

HotelInfo.Name: Confortel Bel Art
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Lepanto 406, 08025 Barcelona, Spain
